verbs.description: unhang (third-person singular simple present unhangs, present participle unhanging, simple past and past participle unhung)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To take down something (such as a picture) from a hanging position

verbs.description: unhang (third-person singular simple present unhangs, present participle unhanging, simple past and past participle unhanged)

entries.meaning: (transitive) Hypothetically, to undo the execution of (a person) by hanging.
examples: There is a clear line of distinction in this matter. An equity judge could not unhang a man who had been wrongfully hanged; but he could set aside a precedent which was manifestly contrary to law and justice.
